column2: Double-stranded cDNA obtained in step (Illumina Second Strand cDNA synthesis).5 is fragmented using DNase I to generatesmall fragments of cDNA suitable for sequencing using an Illumina Genome Analyzer.
Mix 8 _l of water, 1 _l of DNase I buffer, and 1 _l of DNase I enzyme (2 U/_l) in amicrocentrifuge tube.
Add 2 _l of this mixture to 25 _l of cDNA from step (Illumina, Fragment ds cDNA).1

column5: Output from prior protocol (Illumina Second Strand cDNA synthesis); ds DNA
Output from prior step (Illumina, Fragment ds cDNA).1

column2: Add nuclease-free water to bring the total volume of 34 _l
Immediately transfer to a 100_C heat block
incubate for 10 min to terminate the DNase I reaction.

column5: to terminate the DNase I reaction

Failure to do this in a timely fashion can result in completely digested cDNA. This incubation time is optimized for yeast and may need to be optimized for other organisms, particularly if the average transcript length differs significantly from yeast. See Critical Parameters and Troubleshooting for further details.

column2: Purify the fragmented cDNA using the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit. Follow the manufacturer's recommended protocol, but elute in a final volume of 34 _l of Buffer EB.

column5: Nucleic Acid, cDNA, fragmented, in Buffer EB
Follow the manufacturer's recommended protocol, but elute in a final volume of 34 _l of Buffer EB

column2: Place the tube on ice until ready for library preparation.
